ca.uwaterloo.epad.painting

Class Stroke

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.uwaterloo.epad.painting.Stroke

  • public class Stroke
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents a single stroke on the canvas.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Dmitry Pyryeskin
    See Also:
    StrokePoint

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      long id
      Unique identifier of the stroke object.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Stroke(vialab.SMT.Touch t, Canvas c)
      Default constructor creates a Stroke object and stores the coordinated of the Touch object translated to the coordinate space of the Canvas.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      StrokePoint getLastPoint() 
      java.util.Vector<StrokePoint> getPath() 
      void render(processing.core.PGraphics g)
      Render the stroke based on the Brush and Paint objects.
      void update(vialab.SMT.Touch t)
      Update the stroke by adding the coordinates of the given Touch object translated to the coordinate space of the Canvas to it.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Field Detail

      • id

        public long id
        Unique identifier of the stroke object. Is equal to the ID of the Touch object that created the stroke.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Stroke

        public Stroke(vialab.SMT.Touch t,
      Canvas c)
        Default constructor creates a Stroke object and stores the coordinated of the Touch object translated to the coordinate space of the Canvas.
        Parameters:
        t - Touch object
        c - Canvas

    • Method Detail

      • update

        public void update(vialab.SMT.Touch t)
        Update the stroke by adding the coordinates of the given Touch object translated to the coordinate space of the Canvas to it.
        Parameters:
        t - Touch object

      • render

        public void render(processing.core.PGraphics g)
        Render the stroke based on the Brush and Paint objects.
        Parameters:
        g - PGraphics to render the stroke into.
        See Also:
        Brush.renderStroke(Stroke, int, PGraphics), Paint.getColour()

      • getPath

        public java.util.Vector<StrokePoint> getPath()
        Returns:
        the entire path of the stroke.

      • getLastPoint

        public StrokePoint getLastPoint()
        Returns:
        the last point of the stroke.
